quote_first: He begins to make a record of our observations.“
quote_last: ,” he writes, as we crouch at the top of the stairs, listening to his mother in the hall below.
title: Spies
author: Michael Frayn

quote_first: I gaze and gaze again at that face, which seems to me both strange and familiar, said Austerlitz, I run the tape back repeatedly, looking at the time indicator in the top left-hand corner of the screen, where the figures covering part of her forehead show the minutes and seconds, from
quote_last: to 10:57, while the hundredths of a second flash by so fast that you cannot read and capture them.
title: Austerlitz
author: W.G. Sebald

quote_first:
There was a movement and an exclamation from my right, and peering through the floom I saw Whitney, pale, haggard, and unkempt, staring out at me.
“My God! It’s Watson,” said he. He was in a pitiable state of reaction, with every nerve in a twitter. “I say, Watson, what o’clock is it?”
“
title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
